scenario.title: Crisis in the Coffee Shop
scenario.context: A local coffee shop during a busy afternoon rush
scenario.description: The espresso machine at a popular local coffee shop breaks down during a busy afternoon. Customers are waiting for their orders and growing impatient. The barista, Alex, is trying to figure out what to do. Terry, a regular customer and experienced barista at another coffee shop, is waiting for his coffee.
scenario.speaker1_persona: Although she is generally friendly and calm, Alex is feeling stressed and overwhelmed in this situation. She's never dealt with a broken espresso machine before.
scenario.speaker2_persona_1: High EQ - Terry remains calm and patient despite the problem. He offers practical advice to Alex based on his experience and encourages her to take a moment to think and approach the problem systematically.
scenario.speaker2_persona_2: Low EQ - Terry becomes impatient and irritated. He criticizes Alex for not knowing how to fix the machine and makes sarcastic comments about her competence.
scenario.speaker2_persona_3: Low EQ - Terry becomes anxious and starts to panic. He insists that Alex should call the manufacturer right away, even though it's unlikely they would be able to provide immediate help, and suggests that she should close the shop until the machine is fixed.
scenario.speaker2_persona_high: High EQ - Terry remains calm and patient despite the problem. He offers practical advice to Alex based on his experience and encourages her to take a moment to think and approach the problem systematically.
scenario.speaker2_persona_low: Low EQ - Terry becomes impatient and irritated. He criticizes Alex for not knowing how to fix the machine and makes sarcastic comments about her competence.

conversation.speaker: speaker1
conversation.text: Oh no, the espresso machine is acting up again! I'm really sorry everyone, we're having a bit of an issue here.

conversation.speaker: speaker2
conversation.text: Hey Alex, no need to panic. I've seen this issue before at my shop. Would you like some help?

conversation.speaker: speaker1
conversation.text: Really, Terry? That would be great. I don't want to keep all these people waiting.

conversation.speaker: speaker2
conversation.text: Alright. Let's first turn it off, then check the water temperature. It's usually a simple fix.

conversation.speaker: speaker1
conversation.text: Okay, sounds like a plan. Thanks so much, Terry. I was starting to lose my mind.

conversation.speaker: speaker2
conversation.text: No worries, Alex. We all have those days. Let's get this sorted out together.
